intro: Clematis subfalcata, commonly known as the narrowleaf clematis, is a deciduous climbing vine native to the eastern United States. It features slender, twining stems that can reach lengths of up to 15 feet, allowing it to climb trees and shrubs. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white to pale blue, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a distinctive narrow, sickle-shaped appearance. Clematis subfalcata prefers partial to full sun and well-drained soil, making it a versatile choice for garden landscapes.
